anyOf.description: A text input to the model, equivalent to a text input with the `user` role.

A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.
A text input to the model.

anyOf.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

anyOf.description: The results of the file search tool call.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`,
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

anyOf.title: File search tool call

anyOf.description:
A tool call to a computer use tool. See the
[computer use guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-computer-use) for more information.
A click action.

button.description: Indicates which mouse button was pressed during the click. One of `left`, `right`, `wheel`, `back`, or `forward`.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a click action, this property is always `click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the click occurred.

anyOf.title: Click

anyOf.description: A double click action.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a double click action, this property is always set to `double_click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the double click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the double click occurred.

anyOf.title: DoubleClick

anyOf.description: A drag action.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array
of objects, eg
```
[
  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

items.description: An x/y coordinate pair, e.g. `{ x: 100, y: 200 }`.
items.title: Coordinate

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is 
always set to `drag`.

anyOf.title: Drag

anyOf.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

keys.description: The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an array of strings, each representing a key.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is always set to `keypress`.

anyOf.title: KeyPress

anyOf.description: A mouse move action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a move action, this property is 
always set to `move`.

anyOf.title: Move

anyOf.description: A screenshot action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a screenshot action, this property is 
always set to `screenshot`.

anyOf.title: Screenshot

anyOf.description: A scroll action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a scroll action, this property is 
always set to `scroll`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

anyOf.title: Scroll

anyOf.description: An action to type in text.

text.description: The text to type.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a type action, this property is 
always set to `type`.

anyOf.title: Type

anyOf.description: A wait action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a wait action, this property is 
always set to `wait`.

anyOf.title: Wait

for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state).

anyOf.description: Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response

A system (or developer) message inserted into the model's context.
When used along with `previous_response_id`, the instructions from a previous response will not be carried over to the next response. This makes it simple to swap out system (or developer) messages in new responses.

model.description: Model ID used to generate the response, like `gpt-5` or `o3`. OpenAI offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance characteristics, and price points. Refer to the [model guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models) to browse and compare available models.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations. Learn more about [conversation state](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state). Cannot be used in conjunction with `conversation`.
A text input to the model, equivalent to a text input with the `user` role.

A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.

anyOf.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content 
types.

anyOf.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision).

anyOf.description: A file input to the model.

Input item content list

content.description:
Text, image, or audio input to the model, used to generate a response.
Can also contain previous assistant responses.

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
`developer`.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.

anyOf.title: Input message

anyOf.description:
An item representing part of the context for the response to be
generated by the model. Can contain text, images, and audio inputs,
as well as previous assistant responses and tool call outputs.
anyOf.title: Item

anyOf.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role.

content.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content 
types.

text.description: The text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

detail.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.

anyOf.description: The ID of the file to be sent to the model.
The URL of the image to be sent to the model. A fully qualified URL or base64 encoded image in a data URL.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the URL citation in the message.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the container file citation in the message.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

The top log probability of a token.

Log probability

text.description: The text output from the model.

role.description: The role of the output message. Always `assistant`.

The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or

anyOf.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

anyOf.description: The results of the file search tool call.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`,
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

anyOf.title: File search tool call

anyOf.description:
A tool call to a computer use tool. See the
[computer use guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-computer-use) for more information.
A click action.

button.description: Indicates which mouse button was pressed during the click. One of `left`, `right`, `wheel`, `back`, or `forward`.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a click action, this property is always `click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the click occurred.

anyOf.title: Click

anyOf.description: A double click action.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a double click action, this property is always set to `double_click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the double click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the double click occurred.

anyOf.title: DoubleClick

anyOf.description: A drag action.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array
of objects, eg
```
[
  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

items.description: An x/y coordinate pair, e.g. `{ x: 100, y: 200 }`.
items.title: Coordinate

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is 
always set to `drag`.

anyOf.title: Drag

anyOf.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

keys.description: The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an array of strings, each representing a key.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is always set to `keypress`.

anyOf.title: KeyPress

anyOf.description: A mouse move action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a move action, this property is 
always set to `move`.

anyOf.title: Move

anyOf.description: A screenshot action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a screenshot action, this property is 
always set to `screenshot`.

anyOf.title: Screenshot

anyOf.description: A scroll action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a scroll action, this property is 
always set to `scroll`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

anyOf.title: Scroll

anyOf.description: An action to type in text.

text.description: The text to type.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a type action, this property is 
always set to `type`.

anyOf.title: Type

anyOf.description: A wait action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a wait action, this property is 
always set to `wait`.

anyOf.title: Wait

call_id.description: An identifier used when responding to the tool call with output.

id.description: The unique ID of the computer call.

pending_safety_checks.description: The pending safety checks for the computer call.

items.description: A pending safety check for the computer call.

anyOf.description: The type of the pending safety check.

id.description: The ID of the pending safety check.

anyOf.description: Details about the pending safety check.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the computer call. Always `computer_call`.

anyOf.title: Computer tool call

anyOf.description: The output of a computer tool call.
The safety checks reported by the API that have been acknowledged by the developer.

anyOf.description: The type of the pending safety check.

id.description: The ID of the pending safety check.

anyOf.description: Details about the pending safety check.

call_id.description: The ID of the computer tool call that produced the output.

anyOf.description: The ID of the computer tool call output.

output.description: A computer screenshot image used with the computer use tool.

file_id.description: The identifier of an uploaded file that contains the screenshot.

image_url.description: The URL of the screenshot image.

Specifies the event type. For a computer screenshot, this property is 
always set to `computer_screenshot`.

anyOf.description: The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

anyOf.description:
The results of a web search tool call. See the
[web search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search) for more information.
Action type "search" - Performs a web search query.

sources.description: The sources used in the search.

items.description: A source used in the search.

type.description: The type of source. Always `url`.

url.description: The URL opened by the model.

anyOf.description: Action type "find": Searches for a pattern within a loaded page.

pattern.description: The pattern or text to search for within the page.

url.description: The URL of the page searched for the pattern.

An object describing the specific action taken in this web search call.
Includes details on how the model used the web (search, open_page, find).

status.description: The status of the web search tool call.

type.description: The type of the web search tool call. Always `web_search_call`.

`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

anyOf.description:
A description of the chain of thought used by a reasoning model while generating
a response. Be sure to include these items in your `input` to the Responses API
for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state).

items.description: Reasoning text from the model.

text.description: The reasoning text from the model.

type.description: The type of the reasoning text. Always `reasoning_text`.

items.title: ReasoningTextContent

anyOf.description:
The encrypted content of the reasoning item - populated when a response is
generated with `reasoning.encrypted_content` in the `include` parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier of the reasoning content.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

items.description: A summary text from the model.

text.description: A summary of the reasoning output from the model so far.

type.description: The type of the object. Always `summary_text`.

items.title: Summary text

type.description: The type of the object. Always `reasoning`.

The outputs generated by the code interpreter, such as logs or images.

anyOf.description: Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response

A system (or developer) message inserted into the model's context.
When used along with `previous_response_id`, the instructions from a previous response will not be carried over to the next response. This makes it simple to swap out system (or developer) messages in new responses.

model.description: Model ID used to generate the response, like `gpt-5` or `o3`. OpenAI offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance characteristics, and price points. Refer to the [model guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models) to browse and compare available models.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations. Learn more about [conversation state](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state). Cannot be used in conjunction with `conversation`.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the compacted conversation was created.

id.description: The unique identifier for the compacted response.

output.description: The compacted list of output items. This is a list of all user messages, followed by a single compaction item.

content.description: The content of the output message.

anyOf.description: A text output from the model.

annotations.description: The annotations of the text output.

filename.description: The filename of the file cited.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

type.description: The type of the file citation. Always `file_citation`.

anyOf.title: File citation

anyOf.description: A citation for a web resource used to generate a model response.

end_index.description: The index of the last character of the URL citation in the message.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the URL citation in the message.

title.description: The title of the web resource.

type.description: The type of the URL citation. Always `url_citation`.

url.description: The URL of the web resource.

anyOf.title: URL citation

anyOf.description: A citation for a container file used to generate a model response.

container_id.description: The ID of the container file.

end_index.description: The index of the last character of the container file citation in the message.

filename.description: The filename of the container file cited.

start_index.description: The index of the first character of the container file citation in the message.

type.description: The type of the container file citation. Always `container_file_citation`.

anyOf.title: Container file citation

anyOf.description: A path to a file.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

type.description: The type of the file path. Always `file_path`.

anyOf.title: File path

items.description: The log probability of a token.
The top log probability of a token.
items.title: Top log probability
Log probability

text.description: The text output from the model.

type.description: The type of the output text. Always `output_text`.

anyOf.title: Output text

anyOf.description: A refusal from the model.

refusal.description: The refusal explanation from the model.

type.description: The type of the refusal. Always `refusal`.

anyOf.title: Refusal

id.description: The unique ID of the output message.

role.description: The role of the output message. Always `assistant`.

status.description:
The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the output message. Always `message`.

anyOf.title: Output message

anyOf.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

anyOf.description: The results of the file search tool call.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`,
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

anyOf.title: File search tool call

anyOf.description:
A tool call to run a function. See the 
[function calling guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

name.description: The name of the function to run.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call. Always `function_call`.

anyOf.title: Function tool call

anyOf.description:
The results of a web search tool call. See the
[web search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search) for more information.
Action type "search" - Performs a web search query.

sources.description: The sources used in the search.

items.description: A source used in the search.

type.description: The type of source. Always `url`.

items.title: Web search source

sources.title: Web search sources

type.description: The action type.

anyOf.title: Search action

anyOf.description: Action type "open_page" - Opens a specific URL from search results.

type.description: The action type.

url.description: The URL opened by the model.

anyOf.title: Open page action

anyOf.description: Action type "find": Searches for a pattern within a loaded page.

pattern.description: The pattern or text to search for within the page.

type.description: The action type.

url.description: The URL of the page searched for the pattern.

anyOf.title: Find action

action.description:
An object describing the specific action taken in this web search call.
Includes details on how the model used the web (search, open_page, find).

id.description: The unique ID of the web search tool call.

status.description: The status of the web search tool call.

type.description: The type of the web search tool call. Always `web_search_call`.

anyOf.title: Web search tool call

anyOf.description:
A tool call to a computer use tool. See the
[computer use guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-computer-use) for more information.
A click action.

button.description: Indicates which mouse button was pressed during the click. One of `left`, `right`, `wheel`, `back`, or `forward`.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a click action, this property is always `click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the click occurred.

anyOf.title: Click

anyOf.description: A double click action.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a double click action, this property is always set to `double_click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the double click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the double click occurred.

anyOf.title: DoubleClick

anyOf.description: A drag action.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array
of objects, eg
```
[
  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

items.description: An x/y coordinate pair, e.g. `{ x: 100, y: 200 }`.
items.title: Coordinate

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is 
always set to `drag`.

anyOf.title: Drag

anyOf.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

keys.description: The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an array of strings, each representing a key.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is always set to `keypress`.

anyOf.title: KeyPress

anyOf.description: A mouse move action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a move action, this property is 
always set to `move`.

anyOf.title: Move

anyOf.description: A screenshot action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a screenshot action, this property is 
always set to `screenshot`.

anyOf.title: Screenshot

anyOf.description: A scroll action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a scroll action, this property is 
always set to `scroll`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

anyOf.title: Scroll

anyOf.description: An action to type in text.

text.description: The text to type.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a type action, this property is 
always set to `type`.

anyOf.title: Type

anyOf.description: A wait action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a wait action, this property is 
always set to `wait`.

anyOf.title: Wait

call_id.description: An identifier used when responding to the tool call with output.

id.description: The unique ID of the computer call.

pending_safety_checks.description: The pending safety checks for the computer call.

items.description: A pending safety check for the computer call.

anyOf.description: The type of the pending safety check.

id.description: The ID of the pending safety check.

anyOf.description: Details about the pending safety check.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the computer call. Always `computer_call`.

anyOf.title: Computer tool call

anyOf.description:
A description of the chain of thought used by a reasoning model while generating
a response. Be sure to include these items in your `input` to the Responses API
for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state).

items.description: Reasoning text from the model.

text.description: The reasoning text from the model.

type.description: The type of the reasoning text. Always `reasoning_text`.

items.title: ReasoningTextContent

anyOf.description:
The encrypted content of the reasoning item - populated when a response is
generated with `reasoning.encrypted_content` in the `include` parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier of the reasoning content.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

items.description: A summary text from the model.

text.description: A summary of the reasoning output from the model so far.

type.description: The type of the object. Always `summary_text`.

items.title: Summary text

type.description: The type of the object. Always `reasoning`.

anyOf.title: Reasoning

anyOf.description: A compaction item generated by the [`v1/responses/compact` API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/responses/compact).

id.description: The unique ID of the compaction item.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `compaction`.

anyOf.title: Compaction item

anyOf.description: An image generation request made by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the image generation call.

anyOf.description: The generated image encoded in base64.

status.description: The status of the image generation call.

type.description: The type of the image generation call. Always `image_generation_call`.

anyOf.title: Image generation call

anyOf.description: A tool call to run code.
The code to run, or null if not available.

container_id.description: The ID of the container used to run the code.

id.description: The unique ID of the code interpreter tool call.

anyOf.description:
The outputs generated by the code interpreter, such as logs or images.
Can be null if no outputs are available.
The logs output from the code interpreter.

logs.description: The logs output from the code interpreter.

type.description: The type of the output. Always `logs`.

anyOf.title: Code interpreter output logs

anyOf.description: The image output from the code interpreter.

type.description: The type of the output. Always `image`.

url.description: The URL of the image output from the code interpreter.

anyOf.title: Code interpreter output image

status.description: The status of the code interpreter tool call. Valid values are `in_progress`, `completed`, `incomplete`, `interpreting`, and `failed`.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool call. Always `code_interpreter_call`.

anyOf.title: Code interpreter tool call

anyOf.description: A tool call to run a command on the local shell.

action.description: Execute a shell command on the server.

env.description: Environment variables to set for the command.

anyOf.description: Optional timeout in milliseconds for the command.

type.description: The type of the local shell action. Always `exec`.

anyOf.description: Optional user to run the command as.
Optional working directory to run the command in.

action.title: Local shell exec action

call_id.description: The unique ID of the local shell tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the local shell call.

status.description: The status of the local shell call.

type.description: The type of the local shell call. Always `local_shell_call`.

anyOf.title: Local shell call

anyOf.description: A tool call that executes one or more shell commands in a managed environment.

action.description: The shell commands and limits that describe how to run the tool call.

items.description: A list of commands to run.

anyOf.description: Optional maximum number of characters to return from each command.
Optional timeout in milliseconds for the commands.

action.title: Shell exec action

call_id.description: The unique ID of the shell tool call generated by the model.

created_by.description: The ID of the entity that created this tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the shell tool call. Populated when this item is returned via API.

status.description: The status of the shell call. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `shell_call`.

anyOf.title: Shell tool call

anyOf.description: The output of a shell tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the shell tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the shell call output. Populated when this item is returned via API.

anyOf.description: The maximum length of the shell command output. This is generated by the model and should be passed back with the raw output.

output.description: An array of shell call output contents

items.description: The content of a shell call output.

anyOf.description: Indicates that the shell call exceeded its configured time limit.

type.description: The outcome type. Always `timeout`.

anyOf.title: Shell call timeout outcome

anyOf.description: Indicates that the shell commands finished and returned an exit code.

exit_code.description: Exit code from the shell process.

type.description: The outcome type. Always `exit`.

anyOf.title: Shell call exit outcome

outcome.description: Represents either an exit outcome (with an exit code) or a timeout outcome for a shell call output chunk.
outcome.title: Shell call outcome

items.title: Shell call output content

type.description: The type of the shell call output. Always `shell_call_output`.

anyOf.title: Shell call output

anyOf.description: A tool call that applies file diffs by creating, deleting, or updating files.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call generated by the model.

created_by.description: The ID of the entity that created this tool call.

id.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call. Populated when this item is returned via API.

anyOf.description: Instruction describing how to create a file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to create.

type.description: Create a new file with the provided diff.

anyOf.title: Apply patch create file operation

anyOf.description: Instruction describing how to delete a file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to delete.

type.description: Delete the specified file.

anyOf.title: Apply patch delete file operation

anyOf.description: Instruction describing how to update a file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to update.

type.description: Update an existing file with the provided diff.

anyOf.title: Apply patch update file operation

operation.description: One of the create_file, delete_file, or update_file operations applied via apply_patch.
operation.title: Apply patch operation

status.description: The status of the apply patch tool call. One of `in_progress` or `completed`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `apply_patch_call`.

anyOf.title: Apply patch tool call

anyOf.description: The output emitted by an apply patch tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call generated by the model.

created_by.description: The ID of the entity that created this tool call output.

id.description: The unique ID of the apply patch tool call output. Populated when this item is returned via API.

anyOf.description: Optional textual output returned by the apply patch tool.

status.description: The status of the apply patch tool call output. One of `completed` or `failed`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `apply_patch_call_output`.

anyOf.title: Apply patch tool call output

anyOf.description: An invocation of a tool on an MCP server.

Unique identifier for the MCP tool call approval request.
Include this value in a subsequent `mcp_approval_response` input to approve or reject the corresponding tool call.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments passed to the tool.

anyOf.description: The error from the tool call, if any.

id.description: The unique ID of the tool call.

name.description: The name of the tool that was run.

anyOf.description: The output from the tool call.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server running the tool.

status.description: The status of the tool call. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, `incomplete`, `calling`, or `failed`.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_call`.

anyOf.title: MCP tool call

anyOf.description: A list of tools available on an MCP server.
Error message if the server could not list tools.

id.description: The unique ID of the list.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server.

tools.description: The tools available on the server.

items.description: A tool available on an MCP server.

anyOf.description: Additional annotations about the tool.
The description of the tool.

input_schema.description: The JSON schema describing the tool's input.

items.title: MCP list tools tool

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_list_tools`.

anyOf.title: MCP list tools

anyOf.description: A request for human approval of a tool invocation.

arguments.description: A JSON string of arguments for the tool.

id.description: The unique ID of the approval request.

name.description: The name of the tool to run.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server making the request.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_approval_request`.

anyOf.title: MCP approval request

anyOf.description: A call to a custom tool created by the model.

call_id.description: An identifier used to map this custom tool call to a tool call output.

id.description: The unique ID of the custom tool call in the OpenAI platform.

input.description: The input for the custom tool call generated by the model.

name.description: The name of the custom tool being called.

type.description: The type of the custom tool call. Always `custom_tool_call`.

anyOf.title: Custom tool call

usage.description: Token accounting for the compaction pass, including cached, reasoning, and total tokens.

input_tokens_details.description: A detailed breakdown of the input tokens.

cached_tokens.description:
The number of tokens that were retrieved from the cache. 
[More on prompt caching](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-caching).

output_tokens_details.description: A detailed breakdown of the output tokens.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used.
